thread.title: Tasmania red hot on Chinese market
thread.title_full: Tasmania red hot on Chinese market

title: Tasmania red hot on Chinese market
text:
Mon, Sep 14, 2015, 6:39 PM AEST - Australia Markets closed Tasmania red hot on Chinese market AAP – 26 minutes ago Print 
A Tasmanian trade delegation to China has highlighted the island state's growing appeal with keen interest from one of the world's largest banks, along with airlines wanting to operate direct flights to and from Australia's southernmost capital. 
Premier Will Hodgman led the delegation and after arriving back home on Monday told reporters that the People's Bank of China had set up a working group to look at Tasmanian investment opportunities and that he spoke with "a number" of airlines showing an interest in setting up a direct Tasmanian route. 
"I'm reticent to identify specifically those airlines that may be interested in Tasmania, for commercial reasons, but there is very real interest," Mr Hodgman said, adding that direct flights would not be a possibility until an upgrade of Hobart Airport is completed in 2017. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook Hockey and Abbott joined at the hip AAP 
Speculation has been rife in recent weeks that Joe Hockey would be dumped as treasurer. Few would have suspected …
